content: अरिष्ट {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Unhurt; perfect, complete; imperishable, undecaying, secure, safe; अरिष्टं गच्छ पंथानं, अरिष्टं मार्गमातिष्ठत् पुण्यं वा तु निषेवितं <ls>Rām.</ls> --ष्टः {@--1@} A heron (कंक). {@--2@} A raven, crow. {@--3@} An enemy; अरिष्टस्त्वाष्ट्रस्य <ls>Mv. 4. 18.</ls> {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of various plants: ({%a%}) the soap-berry tree (<ab>Mar.</ab> रिठा); ({%b%}) another plant (<ab>Mar.</ab> निंब). {@--5@} Garlic. {@--6@} A distilled mixture. {@--7@} <ab>N.</ab> of a demon killed by Kṛṣṇa; a son of Bali. --ष्टा {@--1@} A bandage. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a medical plant (कटुका). {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a daughter of Dakṣa and one of the wives of Kaśyapa. --ष्टं {@--1@} Bad or ill luck, evil, misfortune, calamity. {@--2@} A portentous phenomenon foreboding misfortune, unlucky omen (such as earth-quake). {@--3@} Unfavourable symptom, especially of approaching death; रोगिणो मरणं यस्मादवश्यं भावि लक्ष्यते . तल्लक्षणमरिष्टं स्याद्रिष्टमप्यभिधीयते .. {@--4@} Good fortune or luck, happiness. {@--5@} The lying-in-chamber, delivery-room, women's apartments (अंतःपुरं); अपस्नात इवरिष्टं प्रविवेश गृहोत्तमं <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--6@} Butter-milk. {@--7@} Spirituous liquor; <ls>Śi. 18. 77.</ls>
